result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent (2nd+ offense)

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle L. McGeshick

defendant.name: McGeshick, Kyle L.
defendant.address: 400 W Grant Street, Apt 8, Crandon, WI 54520

records.addlTxt: 10:32 AM Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney John Zich.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Here for PH, State calls Sgt. James Jezeski as first witness. Sworn in, 10:34 AM. State asks for judicial notice of Oneida County case 18CF99 JOC for today's purposes. Zich does not object. Court will take judicial notice of that case. State directs, 10:36 PM. Record reflects proper identification of defendant, 10:41 AM. Cross-examination by Attorney Zich, 10:41 AM. Witness excused, 10:42 AM. State calls second witness, John A Skenandore. Sworn in 10:43 AM. State directs. Cross-examination by Attorney Zich, 10:47 AM. State re-directs, 10:48 AM. Re-cross by Zich, 10:50 AM. Witness excused, 10:51 AM. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, information has been filed. Zich has received a copy of information, proceed to ARGN, waives reading, enters NG pleas. Court accepts NG please, will have set on JT calendar, explains can pre-trial with DA for possible resolution, continues bond and explains any motions filed - attorney can appear by zoom if proper order is filed and signed, defendant would be required to appear in person.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol. No contact with A.C.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

08:59 AM Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick in court with attorney John Zich.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zich appears via video. Court has previously advised the defendant of the charges and penalties. Zich will waive further hearing, requests PH, will waive time limits for it. McGeshick makes statement regarding addressing bond as he was told by Court Commissioner that he could do that. Court will have attorney make that argument. McGeshick keeps making statements. Court looks at complaint, confused on the 2nd offense portion. State will look into a repeater offense for that. Zich makes argument for lower cash bond or signature bond for stated reasons. Court makes statement regarding his decision. State - bond - same concerns court has but leave it up to Court to decide. Court reviews file and criminal history - bond - reduces bond to $1000.00 cash and remainder can be returned to the poster, considers time limits waived for PH, sets for PH on 4/14/22 at 10:30 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:38 AM Defendant Kyle L. McGeshick appears by video, in custody, FC Jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kyle L. McGeshick has received a copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. McGeshick understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. McGeshick has contacted an attorney and sent letter asking for bond reduction, believes Halyburton was appointed to her case, but she would not accept his case and they were going to find someone else for him, possibly Attorney Zick. Court will have set for AIA and addresses bond. McGeshick indicates he has a warrant out of another county, suggests maybe lower cash bond or signature bond on this case, has job. Court questions employment. McGeshick responds. State asks for bond to remain for reasons as stated on the record. Court will continue bond at this point and schedules AIA for 3/23/22 at 9:00 AM. Adjourned 9:46 AM.

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle L. McGeshick
Current: 400 W Grant Street, Apt 8, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 03-15-2022)
Prior: 664 Thayer Street, Rhinelander, WI 54501
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with A.C.
